Puella Magi Madoka Magica

Puella Magi Madoka Magica

Puella Magi Madoka Magica (Anime)

Winter, 2011 Anime | Episodes

Series ID 2552
English Title Puella Magi Madoka Magica
Aliases
Romaji Title Mahou Shoujo Madoka ★ Magika
Furigana Title まほうしょうじょまどかマギカ
Japanese Title 魔法少女まどか☆マギカ
Japanese Studio Name シャフト
English Studio Name Shaft
Content Rating M - Mature
Genre Tags sci-fi, magical girl, drama, fantasy
Release Date 2011/01/07
Links Home Page EN Wiki JP Wiki
Character Popularity * 16

Extra Info

Number of Episodes 12


Story & Information -

In the city of Mitakihara, a 14-year old girl named Madoka Kaname and her best friend Sayaka Miki are approached by a strange familiar named Kyubey. This creature offers a contract in which a girl can have any wish granted in exchange for becoming a magical girl tasked with fighting against Witches, manifestations of despair that are responsible for unexplained murders and suicides. Meanwhile, a transfer student named Homura Akemi tries to stop Madoka from becoming a magical girl at all costs. As Madoka contemplates becoming a magical girl, she learns that a magical girl's life isn't as glamorous as she thought and is filled with anguish, suffering and despair. Soon coming to learn the dark secrets between magical girls and witches and the burden it places on her friends, Madoka struggles to decide if there really is a wish worth risking her life for.
The spin-off manga, Puella Magi Kazumi Magica: The Innocent Malice, takes place in Asunaru City and follows an amnesiac magical girl named Kazumi who, along with a band of other magical girls known as the Pleiades Saints, starts to discover the dark nature of magical girls as she regains her memories. Puella Magi Oriko Magica takes place in an alternate timeline to the main series, in which Homura, Mami Tomoe and Kyōko Sakura, along with a young orphaned girl named Yuma Chitose who was abused as a child by her mother, find themselves up against a magical girl pair, Oriko Mikuni and Kirika Kure, who are hunting other magical girls. The prequel story, Puella Magi Oriko Magica: Noisy Citrine, follows Kirka as she starts out being a magical girl and has an encounter with her old childhood friend, Erika. Puella Magi Madoka Magica: The Different Story also takes place in an alternate timeline, mainly focusing on Mami's relationships with the other magical girls.

Jun 6, 2012

Brave Knight


Akikojam 		Score:1 Am I the only one who didn't find this anime any interesting at all. From how it was overly popular and mahou shoujo, I kinda expected something like Lyrical Nanoha, but... maybe it would've been good, if only the characters were faster thinkers. I mean, most of the---- could've been avoided if only they didn't spend several episodes on being confused. So this crap is pretty much registered as Mahou Shoujo Elfen Lied in my brain... maybe a bit mixed with Melody of Oblivion, in the terms of brain assault. Also, they clearly didn't watch enough Dragonball to decide what to do with their wishes.
Jun 6, 2012

Shadow Lurker


13x31 		Score:1 Nah, I don't think so. I won't touch this anime with a 10 meter stick. Sure the characters are cute, but when I saw the mahou shoujo genre, I didn't want to watch it. I think i've had my fair share with CCS, Pretty Sammy, and Nanoha XD

But now I think I'm even more adamant about avoiding it XD
Jun 6, 2012

Brave Knight


Akikojam 		Score:1 If only it was something as cute as CCS or Pretty Sammy... Once again, you don't introduce a nice character only to kill him/her. I hate such chinese movie plot "disciple of a dead master", except for Live-a-Live monk scenario.
Jun 6, 2012

Shadow Lurker


13x31 		Score:1 :o I wasn't expecting such a quick response. Yeah, I was also turned off after seeing the "psychological" tag and reading the synopsis on Anime-planet. It also seemed kinda dark when I flipped through the screenshots. But yeah, having someone die in a mahou shoujo really throws off the cuteness... a lot.
